snippet: A district judge ruled that BP should cover some direct damage claims filed against Halliburton, even if the contractor was at fault.
abstract: Judge Carl J Barbier of the United States District Court in New Orleans rules that BP must cover some of the direct damage claims awarded against Halliburton for the $40 billion in cleanup costs and economic losses caused by the 2010 oil well explosion and Gulf of Mexico spill.
lead_paragraph: A district judge ruled that BP should cover some direct damage claims filed against Halliburton, even if the contractor was at fault.

headline.seo: BP Must Indemnify Halliburton in Gulf Spill Claims, Judge Says
headline.main: BP Must Pay Some Gulf Claims Filed Against Halliburton
headline.print_headline: BP Must Pay Some Gulf Claims Filed Against Halliburton
